title: More eyes in the sky: NRO building new satellites to deliver ‘10 times more signals and images’
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office is on track to dramatically increase the number of spy satellites it relies upon to collect intelligence

title: Evolution Space to develop solid rocket motors at NASA Stennis
summary: Evolution Space, a startup developing solid rocket motors, has signed an agreement to establish production and testing operations at NASA’s Stennis Space Center.

title: ESA Sign Agreement with Axiom Space
summary:
The European Space Agency has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Axiom Space to explore collaborations in the fields of human spaceflight, science, technology, and commercialisation. Signed on October 1, the MOU became immediately effective and will span an initial period of three years. The agreement included an option for an extension “based on mutual […]
The post ESA Sign Agreement with Axiom Space appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: For the third time in a year, Russian hardware on the space station is leaking
summary: Will this leak be blamed on "external impacts" as well?

title: Russian ISS module experiences coolant leak
summary: A radiator on the Russian segment of the International Space Station started leaking coolant Oct. 9, the third such incident involving Russian hardware at the station in less than a year.
